definition: to look at from close up/to watch intently
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: I could not hold my calmness any more and shouted at him irritatingly.
sentences.chinese: 我再也無法平靜，眼睛噴了火，逼視着他。

sentences.english: The thief withered under the stare of the policeman.
sentences.chinese: 小偷在警察的逼視下顯得惶恐不安。

sentences.english: The detective sat down facing john, his eyes impaling the young man .
sentences.chinese: 偵探面對約翰坐下，犀利的目光逼視着這個年輕人。

sentences.english: The thief withered under the stare of the policeman .
sentences.chinese: 小偷在警察的逼視下顯得惶恐不安。

sentences.english: The worker level(l)ed their looks at the foreman.
sentences.chinese: 工人們用目光逼視着工頭。

sentences.english: He stared at me, his eyes widening.
sentences.chinese: 他逼視着我，眼睛睜得大大的。

sentences.english: Slim looked through George and beyond him.
sentences.chinese: 斯利姆逼視喬治，並且朝他身後望去。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes and met the stare of a bilious clock.
sentences.chinese: 他擡起雙眼，跟那座逼視着的掛鐘打了個照面。
